guidelines.title: Code of Conduct
guidelines.description: Maintains a respectful and inclusive environment, free from harassment and discrimination, ensuring all contributions are treated fairly.

guidelines.title: Issue Reporting
guidelines.description: Instructs on how to create detailed and descriptive issue reports to facilitate problem resolution.

guidelines.title: Pull Request Process
guidelines.description: Explains the steps required to submit a pull request, including branch naming conventions, and the requirement for clear and concise commit messages.

guidelines.title: Testing
guidelines.description: Emphasizes the importance of running and writing tests to ensure new code does not break existing functionality.

guidelines.title: Coding Standards
guidelines.description: Provides guidelines for maintaining consistent coding styles and practices across the project, such as naming conventions and code formatting.

guidelines.title: Documentation
guidelines.description: Highlights the need for thorough documentation for any code changes, ensuring future contributors can easily understand and work with the updated code.

guidelines.title: Communication
guidelines.description: Encourages open and clear communication through designated channels such as issue discussions or project forums.

guidelines.title: License Agreement
guidelines.description: Requires contributors to accept the project's license terms, ensuring all code submissions are properly licensed and can be legally included in the project.

guidelines.title: Code Style
guidelines.description: Ensure that your code follows the project's coding standards and style guides. This makes the codebase more cohesive and consistent.

guidelines.title: Commit Messages
guidelines.description: Write clear and concise commit messages following the project's conventions. This helps other contributors understand the changes and reasons behind them.

guidelines.title: Pull Requests
guidelines.description: Create well-documented pull requests with detailed explanations of the changes and how they address specific issues. This aids in the review process and improves transparency.

guidelines.title: Issue Reporting
guidelines.description: Report issues using the project's issue tracker with detailed descriptions, steps to reproduce, and relevant information. This helps maintainers quickly identify and address problems.

guidelines.title: Testing
guidelines.description: Write and run tests for your code to ensure it works correctly and does not introduce bugs. This maintains the stability and reliability of the project.

guidelines.title: Documentation
guidelines.description: Update or create documentation as needed to reflect changes or additions to the project. This ensures that other contributors and users can understand and use the new features.

guidelines.title: Fork the Repository
guidelines.description: Developers should fork the main repository to their own GitHub account before making any changes. This is essential to ensure that changes are isolated and can be reviewed independently before being merged into the main project.

guidelines.title: Create a Feature Branch
guidelines.description: Before starting to work on a feature, bug fix or any other change, create a new branch focused on that particular task. This keeps the main codebase clean and makes it easier to manage multiple simultaneous contributions.

guidelines.title: Adhere to Coding Standards
guidelines.description: Follow the project's coding conventions and styling guidelines. Consistent coding habits help maintain readability and make collaborative work easier.

guidelines.title: Write Meaningful Commit Messages
guidelines.description: Use clear and descriptive messages for commits to explain the rationale behind changes. This is helpful for tracking the history of modifications and understanding the purpose of past edits.

guidelines.title: Submit a Pull Request
guidelines.description: After making changes and thoroughly testing them, submit a pull request to have them reviewed and potentially merged into the main project. It's important to describe the changes and why they were made in the pull request summary.

guidelines.title: Include Tests
guidelines.description: Whenever applicable, add tests for the new code to ensure it works as intended and does not break existing functionality. High test coverage is crucial for maintaining software quality.

guidelines.title: Review and Address Feedback
guidelines.description: Actively engage with maintainers who review the pull request, addressing any feedback or suggested changes promptly. This collaboration is key to ensuring the best possible outcome for the contribution.

guidelines.title: Update Documentation
guidelines.description: If the changes affect how the project is used, update the documentation accordingly. Clear and up-to-date documentation helps other developers understand how to utilize the new features or changes.

guidelines.title: Respect the Code of Conduct
guidelines.description: Contributors must adhere to the project's code of conduct to maintain a respectful and productive environment for everyone involved in the project.

guidelines.title: Code of Conduct
guidelines.description: This guideline emphasizes the importance of respecting others, being inclusive, and maintaining a positive environment. It serves to ensure that all contributors are treated with respect and feel welcome.

guidelines.title: Report Issues
guidelines.description: This guideline instructs contributors on how to report issues or bugs they encounter. It typically includes specifics on providing detailed information, steps to reproduce the issue, and the expected outcome to help the maintainers address the problem effectively.

guidelines.title: Submit Pull Requests
guidelines.description: This guideline provides instructions on how to submit pull requests for new features or bug fixes. It often covers branch naming conventions, commit message best practices, and the requirement for tests and documentation updates.

guidelines.title: Follow Coding Standards
guidelines.description: This guideline instructs contributors to adhere to the coding standards used by the project. It helps maintain code consistency, readability, and quality across the codebase.

guidelines.title: Review Process
guidelines.description: This guideline explains the process of code review, including who will review the code, what criteria will be used for acceptance, and how to handle requested changes. It ensures that contributions are scrutinized for quality and functionality.

guidelines.title: Add Tests
guidelines.description: This guideline mandates the inclusion of unit tests or integration tests for new features or changes to the codebase. It ensures that the project maintains high code reliability and that new changes do not break existing functionality.

guidelines.title: Documentation Updates
guidelines.description: This guideline states the necessity of updating documentation when contributing new features or changes. It ensures that the project's documentation stays current and useful for future contributors and users.

guidelines.title: Communication Channels
guidelines.description: This guideline outlines the preferred methods of communication for contributors, such as mailing lists, chat rooms, or issue trackers. It ensures that discussions and support requests are channeled through the appropriate platforms.

guidelines.title: Code of Conduct
guidelines.description: All contributors must adhere to the Code of Conduct to ensure a welcoming and inclusive environment for everyone. This helps maintain a respectful and positive interaction within the community.

guidelines.title: Issue Reporting
guidelines.description: Contributors should follow the issue template when reporting bugs or suggesting features to provide necessary details and context. This ensures issues are clearly understood and can be addressed effectively.

guidelines.title: Pull Request Process
guidelines.description: Contributors should submit pull requests (PRs) with clear descriptions and reference relevant issues. This helps maintain project organization and clarifies the purpose and scope of the changes.

guidelines.title: Coding Standards
guidelines.description: All code contributions should follow the established coding standards and style guides. This ensures consistency, readability, and maintainability across the project.

guidelines.title: Testing and Documentation
guidelines.description: Contributors must include relevant tests and documentation updates with their changes. This ensures new features and fixes are verified and users are informed on how to use them.

guidelines.title: Review Process
guidelines.description: Contributors should be open to feedback and revisions during the code review process. This collaborative approach ensures higher quality and more robust code.

guidelines.title: License Agreement
guidelines.description: Contributors need to agree to the project's licensing terms (often by signing a Contributor License Agreement). This clarifies the legal usage of their contributions within the project.

guidelines.title: Code of Conduct
guidelines.description: Explains the standard of behavior expected from contributors to maintain a welcoming and productive environment.

guidelines.title: Setup Development Environment
guidelines.description: Provides instructions on how to configure your development environment to work on the project efficiently.

guidelines.title: Submitting Pull Requests
guidelines.description: Details the steps for submitting pull requests, including how to format commits, write descriptions, and follow the coding style.

guidelines.title: Reporting Issues
guidelines.description: Outlines the process for reporting bugs or suggesting new features, focusing on clarity and providing necessary details.

guidelines.title: Writing Tests
guidelines.description: Describes the importance of writing tests for new features or bug fixes and provides guidelines on the preferred testing framework and practices.

guidelines.title: Documentation Updates
guidelines.description: Stresses the importance of keeping documentation up-to-date and provides guidelines on how to update or add new documentation.

guidelines.title: Code Style
guidelines.description: Ensure that your code adheres to the project's coding conventions and style guide. This ensures consistency and readability across the project.

guidelines.title: Commit Messages
guidelines.description: Write clear and concise commit messages. This helps in understanding the history of changes and the reasons behind them.

guidelines.title: Pull Requests
guidelines.description: Create pull requests for new features or bug fixes. Provide detailed descriptions and link to any relevant issues. This facilitates code reviews and discussions.

guidelines.title: Testing
guidelines.description: Write comprehensive tests for your code. This helps in maintaining the stability and reliability of the project.

guidelines.title: Documentation
guidelines.description: Update the documentation with details about the changes you are introducing. This ensures that users and contributors have up-to-date and accurate information.

guidelines.title: Issue Reports
guidelines.description: Report issues through the project's issue tracker. Provide necessary details to help maintainers understand and reproduce the issue. This streamlines issue resolution.

guidelines.title: Code Reviews
guidelines.description: Participate in code reviews by providing constructive feedback. This helps in improving code quality and fostering a collaborative environment.

guidelines.title: Respectful Communication
guidelines.description: Communicate respectfully with other contributors and maintainers. This promotes a positive and inclusive community.

guidelines.title: Fork the Repository
guidelines.description: Developers should fork the repository to their own GitHub account. This ensures they can freely make changes without affecting the main codebase.

guidelines.title: Create a Branch
guidelines.description: Before making any changes, developers should create a new branch. This helps in organizing their work and makes it easier to manage pull requests.

guidelines.title: Write Clear Commit Messages
guidelines.description: Commit messages should be clear and descriptive, allowing others to easily understand the purpose of the changes. This practice strengthens project history and aids in troubleshooting.

guidelines.title: Follow Coding Standards
guidelines.description: Adhering to the project's coding standards ensures consistency across the codebase. This improves readability and maintainability.

guidelines.title: Run Tests
guidelines.description: Developers should run all tests to confirm that their changes don't break existing functionality. This is crucial for maintaining the project's stability.

guidelines.title: Submit a Pull Request
guidelines.description: Once changes are complete and tested, developers should submit a pull request for review. This allows maintainers to review the code before merging it into the main branch.

guidelines.title: Participate in Code Reviews
guidelines.description: Engaging in code reviews helps improve code quality through peer feedback. Developers should be open to suggestions and ready to make necessary adjustments.

guidelines.title: Update Documentation
guidelines.description: If changes affect the documentation, updates should be made accordingly. Accurate documentation is vital for users to understand and utilize the project.
